intro: Rapuntium kalmii, commonly known as Kalm's buttercup, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has palmately divided leaves and produces small, hairy fruits. Rapuntium kalmii is often found in the eastern United States and parts of Canada.
